Hello everyone! This is a question about *Batch Push.*

Let’s say I want to create a batch of 10 contacts and one of these contacts already exists in HubSpot. I initiate the batch job and the API returns a conflict error with a message “_Contact already exists. Existing ID: 10551_”. It seems that there is no way currently to know that which of the 10 contacts that I pushed was a duplicate. So I essentially have to query the CRM for this existing contact via the provided ID, remove that contact from my batch and try again, hoping that I don’t hit another duplicate. I would need to do this continuously until the call succeeds. Is there a better way to approach this? Thanks!

i haven’t done anything with HubSpot like this, but in salesforce there is an “upsert” function that allows you to update an object if it already exists or create it if it doesn’t. does this exist for HS?
It seems that this was possible in the legacy API via <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/batch_create_or_update|create_or_update> but it is not available in the latest version.

So I'm trying to think up a strategy for handling staging and production environments. Anyone know if this is possible or have advice/ideas?

Hi folks. I've been playing around with the HubSpot API / Zapier all evening and had no problems with GET requests. Now I need to perform a PATCH request via Zapier but keep getting errors. I think the issue is with the path I'm using. I've tried all sorts of variations and can't find an answer in the documentation. It's for a custom object named 'courses' and a custom property named 'cnf_number' - trying to update the value (to '444' in the example).
Can anyone see any glaring errors in my attempt? Any pointers would be really appreciated or a link to documentation if I've been looking in the wrong place :slightly_smiling_face:
Of course after spending ages trying to figure this out and then posting here, I got it to work. Here's the format I used in case it's helpful to anyone...

Hello Everyone,
  I want to use condition based on value,
  How to use, inputFieldDependencies
  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions>
Yes, it worked :slightly_smiling_face:
